structureFields.description: (Serverside) Disable the ability for players to duplicate this SENT.
structureFields.name: DisableDuplicator

structureFields.description:
(Clientside) Sets the spawnmenu content icon type for the entity, used by spawnmenu in the Sandbox-derived gamemodes.
See {{LibraryFunction|spawnmenu|AddContentType}} for more information.
structureFields.name: ScriptedEntityType

structureFields.description: The entity's name, see {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetName}}.

The key is the physics object index (starts from 0), and the value is a {{Struct|PhysicsObjectSave}}. Unlike other tables in this structure, if there are no physics objects for this entity this will be an empty table.
structureFields.name: PhysicsObjects

structureFields.description: The entity's Flex Scale, see {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetFlexScale}}.
structureFields.name: FlexScale

structureFields.name: Flex

structureFields.description: The entity's body groups, see {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetBodygroup}}. The key is the bodygroup ID and the value is the assigned bodygroup number. Only body groups with a non-default (> 0) value are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.
structureFields.name: BodyG

structureFields.description: Bone manipulation data, see {{ClassFunction|Entity|HasBoneManipulations}}. The key is the bone index and the value is a {{Struct|BoneManipulationData}}. Only bones that have been manipulated with non-default values are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.
structureFields.name: BoneManip

structureFields.description: The entity's MapCreationID, only exists for entities that were created by the map. See {{ClassFunction|Entity|MapCreationID}}.
structureFields.name: MapCreationID

structureFields.description: Deprecated, always 0. See {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetWorkshopID}}.
structureFields.name: WorkshopID

structureFields.description:
The font source. This must be the actual name of the font, not a file name.
Font files are stored in resource/fonts/. This cannot be an existing game font, i.e. "ChatText", "Trebuchet18", etc. ([[Default Fonts]])

The length is limited to 31 characters maximum.
structureFields.name: font

structureFields.description: Allow the font to display glyphs that are outside of the Latin-1 range. Unicode code points above 0xFFFF are not supported.
structureFields.name: extended

structureFields.description:
The font height in pixels

''Maximum:'' 128
structureFields.name: size

structureFields.description: The font boldness
structureFields.name: weight
blursize

structureFields.description:
The "scanline" interval
Must be > 1 to work. This setting is per blursize per font - so if you create a font using "Arial" without scanlines, you cannot create an Arial font using scanlines with the same blursize
structureFields.name: scanlines

structureFields.description: Smooth the font
structureFields.name: antialias

structureFields.description: Add an underline to the font
structureFields.name: underline

structureFields.description: Make the font italic
structureFields.name: italic

structureFields.description: Add a strike through
structureFields.name: strikeout

structureFields.description: Enables the use of symbolic fonts such as Webdings
structureFields.name: symbol

structureFields.description: Seems to add a line in the middle of each letter
structureFields.name: rotary

structureFields.description: Add shadow casting to the font
structureFields.name: shadow

structureFields.description: Additive rendering
structureFields.name: additive

structureFields.description:
Add a black outline to the font.

This does not work well with antialias, and only allows black 1-pixel outlines. It may be preferable to not use this parameter, and instead use {{LibraryFunction|draw|SimpleTextOutlined}} when drawing text that you want outlined.
structureFields.name: outline

structureFields.description: The color of the light source (x is red, y is green, z is blue). Values are not restricted to a specific range, higher values will result in a brighter light.

structureFields.description: The origin of the light in world coordinates.
structureFields.name: pos

structureFields.description: The direction of the light. Only required for directional and spot lights.
structureFields.name: dir

structureFields.description: The maximum range of the light source. Does not actually control light attenuation. Usually left at 0 for infinite range.
structureFields.name: range

structureFields.description: Angular falloff exponent for spot lights. Higher values result in a sharper transition between the inner cone and the outer cone.

structureFields.description: The outer cone angle for spot lights, in degrees.
structureFields.name: outerAngle

structureFields.description: The distance at which the light will fade to 50% of its brightness.
structureFields.name: fiftyPercentDistance

structureFields.description: The distance at which the light will completely fade out.
structureFields.name: zeroPercentDistance

structureFields.description: The quadratic term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.
structureFields.name: quadraticFalloff

structureFields.description: The linear term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.
structureFields.name: linearFalloff

structureFields.description: The constant term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.

structureFields.description: Material density in kg / m^3 (water is 1000). If a surface's density is < 1000, it will float in water. This is used to calculate the total mass of an object.
structureFields.name: density

structureFields.description: Collision elasticity - used to compute coefficient of restitution represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0.01 is soft, 1.0 is hard.
structureFields.name: elasticity

structureFields.description: Physical friction used to slow entities touching the surface represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0.01 is slick, 1.0 is completely rough.
structureFields.name: friction

structureFields.description: Material thickness. If this is 0, the material is not volumetrically solid, and thus the object mass will be calculated as "volume * 0.0254^3 * density" where 0.0254 is meters per inch. If non-zero, the mass will be "surfacearea * thickness * 0.0254^3 * density".
structureFields.name: thickness

structureFields.description: Sound to play when a prop or func_breakable is broken.
structureFields.name: breakSound

structureFields.description: Bullet impact sound with this surface.
structureFields.name: bulletImpactSound

structureFields.description: Physical impact sound when hitting surfaces hard.
structureFields.name: impactHardSound

structureFields.description: Physical impact sound when hitting surfaces softly.
structureFields.name: impactSoftSound

structureFields.description: Unused sound.
structureFields.name: rollingSound

structureFields.description: Friction sound when roughly scraping against an entity.
structureFields.name: scrapeRoughSound

structureFields.description: Friction sound when smoothly scraping against an entity.
structureFields.name: scrapeSmoothSound

structureFields.description: Footstep sound for left foot.
structureFields.name: stepLeftSound

structureFields.description: Footstep sound for right foot.
structureFields.name: stepRightSound

structureFields.description: Unused sound.
structureFields.name: strainSound

structures.description:
Information about a SWEP, used by {{HookFunction|SANDBOX|PlayerGiveSWEP}} and SWEP creation. For list of callbacks, see [[:Category:WEAPON_Hooks]].

While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so addons could use their values.
structures.name: Weapon

structureFields.description: Entity class name of the SWEP (file or folder name of your SWEP). This is set automatically

structureFields.description: (Clientside) Category the SWEP is in
structureFields.name: Category

structureFields.description: Whether this SWEP should be displayed in the Q menu
structureFields.name: Spawnable

structureFields.description: Whether or not only admins can spawn the SWEP from their Q menu
structureFields.name: AdminOnly

structureFields.description: Nice name of the SWEP
structureFields.name: PrintName

structureFields.description: The base weapon to derive from. This '''must''' be a Lua weapon

structureFields.description: Multiplier of deploy speed
structureFields.name: m_WeaponDeploySpeed

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The author of the SWEP to be shown in weapon selection
structureFields.name: Author

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The contacts of the SWEP creator to be shown in weapon selection
structureFields.name: Contact

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The purpose of the SWEP creator to be shown in weapon selection

structureFields.description:
(Clientside) Same as ViewModelFlip, but for the second viewmodel

{{Bug|Issue=3633|Fixed=|The second and third viewmodel will not flip with these variables.}}

structureFields.name: ViewModelFlip2

structureFields.name: ViewModelFOV

structureFields.description: The world model for your SWEP (what you will see in other players hands)

structureFields.description: (Serverside) Whether this weapon can be autoswitched away from when the player runs out of ammo in this weapon or picks up another weapon or ammo

structureFields.description: (Serverside) Whether this weapon can be autoswitched to when the player runs out of ammo in their current weapon or they pick this weapon up

structureFields.description: (Serverside) Decides whether we should switch from/to this

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The scale of the viewmodel bob (viewmodel movement from left to right when walking around)
structureFields.name: BobScale

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The scale of the viewmodel sway (viewmodel position lerp when looking around).

structures.description:
The TOOL table is used in Sandbox tool creation. You can find a list of callbacks on the [[:Category:TOOL Hooks|TOOL Hooks]] page and a list of methods on the [[:Category:Tool|Tool Functions]] page. Do note that some of the fields below have no effect on server-side operations. The tool information box drawn on the HUD while your tool is selected has 2 values that are set by {{LibraryFunction|language|Add}}.
"tool.[tool mode].name" - The tool name (Note this is NOT the same as TOOL.Name)
"tool.[tool mode].desc" - The tool description Ensure that all tool file names are entirely lowercase. Including capital letters can lead to unintended behavior.
structures.name: TOOL

structureFields.description: If set to false, the tool won't be added to the tool menu and players will have to access it by other means.
structureFields.name: AddToMenu

structureFields.description: The tool menu category under which the tool should be listed.
structureFields.name: Category

structureFields.description: The console command to execute upon being selected in the Q menu.
structureFields.name: Command

structureFields.description:
The name of the tool in the Q menu.
Common practice is to set this to "#tool.[lua filename].name" to match the name displayed in the tool information box.
structureFields.name: Name

structureFields.description: The name of the configuration file.
structureFields.name: ConfigName

structureFields.description:
A key-value ( convar name-default value ) table containing the client-side convars to create. All convars will be prefixed with the filename of the tool.

You can later use {{ClassFunction|Tool|GetClientNumber}} or {{ClassFunction|Tool|GetClientInfo}} to retrieve these values.
structureFields.name: ClientConVar

structureFields.description: Same as above, but created server-side instead.
structureFields.name: ServerConVar

structureFields.description:
The function that is called to build the context menu for your tool. It has one argument, namely the context menu's base panel to which all of your custom panels are going to be parented to.

While it might sound like a hook, it isn't - you won't receive a self argument inside the function.
structureFields.name: BuildCPanel

structureFields.description:
Allows you to override the tool usage information shown when the tool is equipped.
See [[Tool Information Display]] for more information.
structureFields.name: Information

structureFields.description: Set this to CurTime() on the client to make the tools information box on the HUD flash white.
structureFields.name: LastMessage

structureFields.description:
{{Deprecated}}

Does nothing. Was used in conjunction with LastMessage in very old versions of the game.
structureFields.name: Message

structureFields.description:
Class name of the tool. (name of the .lua file)

This is set automatically.
structureFields.name: Mode

structureFields.description: The x coordinate on the players screen
structureFields.name: x

structureFields.description: The y coordinate on the players screen
structureFields.name: y

structureFields.description: The coordinate is not behind the player. '''This does not mean the coordinate is on the screen.''' When this is false, it means that the coordinate would not be on the screen even if the player had a full 180 degree FOV.
structureFields.name: visible

filter

structureFields.description: If set, the trace result will be written to the supplied table instead of returning a new table

structureFields.description: The entity hit by the trace.
structureFields.name: Entity

structureFields.description: This indicates the how much of your trace length was used from 0-1 (resultLength/originalLength).
structureFields.name: Fraction

structureFields.description: Given the trace started in a solid enviroment, this will return at what distance the trace left the solid from 0-1. Doesn't work if the trace hit a non-worldspawn entity.
structureFields.name: FractionLeftSolid

structureFields.description: Indicates whether the trace hit something.
structureFields.name: Hit

structureFields.description: The ID of the hitbox hit by the trace.
structureFields.name: HitBox

structureFields.description: {{Enum|HITGROUP}} describing what hitgroup the trace hit (not the same as HitBox).
structureFields.name: HitGroup

structureFields.description: Indicates whenever the trace hit a no-draw brush.
structureFields.name: HitNoDraw

structureFields.description: Indicates whenever the trace did not hit the world.
structureFields.name: HitNonWorld

structureFields.description: The direction of the surface that was hit as a normal vector (vector with [[Vector/Length|length]] of 1).
structureFields.name: HitNormal

structureFields.description: The position the trace stopped. This will be the provided endpos if the trace hit nothing.
structureFields.name: HitPos

structureFields.description: Indicates whenever the trace hit the sky.
structureFields.name: HitSky

structureFields.description: The surface material (not texture) of whatever the trace hit. Will be "**displacement**" if the trace hit a displacement, and **studio** if it hit a prop.
structureFields.name: HitTexture

structureFields.description: Indicates whenever the trace hit the world.
structureFields.name: HitWorld

structureFields.description: {{Enum|MAT}} of the material hit by the trace.
structureFields.name: MatType

structureFields.description: The direction of the trace as a normal vector (vector with [[Vector/Length|length]] of 1).

structureFields.description:
The {{Type|PhysObj}} ID that was hit.

Used for {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetPhysicsObjectNum}}.

structureFields.description: Material index of skid material of the wheels. Upon skidding ( pressing Space and sliding the vehicle ), the wheels will be set to this material.
structureFields.name: wheels_skidMaterialIndex

structureFields.description: Additional gravity to be applied to the vehicle
structureFields.name: addGravity

structureFields.description: Mass center override
structureFields.name: massCenterOverride

structureFields.description: Mass override
structureFields.name: massOverride

structureFields.description: Maximum angular velocity
structureFields.name: maxAngularVelocity

structureFields.description:
This acts as the final ratio of the gearbox.

It's like a master coefficient of the gearbox.
structureFields.name: axleRatio

structureFields.description: Amount of seconds between being able to use the boost ( by pressing Shift key by default )

structureFields.description: Duration of the boost in seconds

boostMaxSpeed

structureFields.description: Amount of gears this vehicle has

A table of numbers, of gear rations.
Table length is equal to "gearCount" member of this table.

The HP amount of the vehicle

This value is used to calculate the effectively applied torque, along with ratios and ''maxRPM''.
structureFields.name: horsepower

structureFields.description: If ''true'', the gearbox shifts gears, if ''false'' the gearbox stays stuck to the 1st gear (gear number 0).
structureFields.name: isAutoTransmission

structureFields.description:
Maximum RPM of the vehicle.
Despite this being a maximum value, the vehicle can exceed it. {{Warning|Attempts to exceed the max RPM will force the active gear ratio to be that of the 1st gear, which will provide even more torque. This is the opposite of a rev limiter. This value is only used for the calculation of the effectively applied torque.}}
structureFields.name: maxRPM
maxRevSpeed
maxSpeed

structureFields.description: Amount of RPM to automatically shift one gear down
structureFields.name: shiftDownRPM

structureFields.description: Amount of RPM to automatically shift one gear up
structureFields.name: shiftUpRPM

structureFields.description: The maximum angle at which the vehicle can turn while boosting

structureFields.description: The maximum angle at which the vehicle can turn while moving slowest

structureFields.description: In Hammer Units

The video container format.

'''Valid options are:''' webm, ogg

The audio codec.

structureFields.name: audio

structureFields.name: quality

structureFields.name: bitrate

structureFields.description: Lock the frame count per second
structureFields.name: lockfps

structureFields.name: name

Table structure used for {{LibraryFunction|render|RenderView}}.

Unless stated otherwise, the default values for all these keys would be inherited from the engine's CViewSetup and do not have static representations.

structureFields.name: drawmonitors

structureFields.name: drawviewmodel

structureFields.name: viewmodelfov

Render the view orthogonal. Can also be a table with these keys: ( In which case orthogonal view is automatically set to true )
* left

* top
* bottom
structureFields.name: ortho

structureFields.description: Coordinate for the left clipping plane

structureFields.name: znearviewmodel

structureFields.description: The distance of the view's origin to the far clipping plane for the viewmodel
structureFields.name: zfarviewmodel

structureFields.description:
<!--Call the {{HookFunction|GM|RenderScreenspaceEffects}} hook-->
Currently works identically to the "bloomtone" option (it also overrides it if you set this to false).
structureFields.name: dopostprocess

structureFields.description: Disables default engine bloom and pauses the "brightness changes" on HDR maps.
structureFields.name: bloomtone

structureFields.description:
This allows you to "zoom in" on a part of the screen - for example, the top-left quarter of the screen. This is similar to how [https://garry.tv/2012/02/25/poster-screenshots/ poster splits the screen] into separate renders.

It's a table with 4 keys, controlling what portion of the screen to draw:
* left - where the left edge starts. Natural value is 0.
* right - where the right edge ends. Natural value is equal to w (the width of the viewport).
* top - where the ''bottom'' edge starts. Natural value is 0.
* bottom - where the ''top'' edge ends. Natural value is equal to h (the height of the viewport).

Note that top and bottom are reversed.

Values outside the viewport are allowed, but not recommended - instead you should increase the view FOV.
structureFields.name: offcenter

structureFields.description: (Clientside) Makes the default SWEP crosshair be positioned in 3D space where your aim actually is (like on Jeep), instead of simply sitting in the middle of the screen at all times
structureFields.name: AccurateCrosshair

structureFields.description: Disable the ability for players to duplicate this SWEP
structureFields.name: DisableDuplicator

structureFields.description:
(Clientside) Sets the spawnmenu content icon type for the entity, used by spawnmenu in the Sandbox-derived gamemodes.
See {{LibraryFunction|spawnmenu|AddContentType}} for more information.
structureFields.name: ScriptedEntityType

structureFields.description: If set to false, the weapon will not play the weapon pick up sound when picked up.
structureFields.name: m_bPlayPickupSound

structures.description:
Information about the ENT structure.
To learn more about scripted entities, [[Scripted_Entities|see this page]].
For list of callbacks, see [[:Category:ENTITY_Hooks|ENT Hooks]]. While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so addons could use their values.
structures.name: ENT

structureFields.description: The base entity to derive from. This '''must''' be a valid Lua entity
structureFields.name: Base

structureFields.description:
Type of the entity. This '''must be one of these:'''
* '''anim'''
* '''brush'''
* '''point'''
* '''ai'''
* '''nextbot'''
* '''filter'''

See [[Scripted Entities]] for a more detailed explanation of what each one is.

{{Bug|You must set this in your entity. This is currently not set to "anim" by default.|2745||1521||No}}
structureFields.name: Type

structureFields.description:
Entity class name of the ENT (File or folder name of your ENT).
'''This is set automatically ''after'' the entity file is loaded.'''
structureFields.name: ClassName

structureFields.description: The folder from where the entity was loaded. This should always be "entity/ent_myentity", regardless whether your ENT is stored as a file, or multiple files in a folder. '''This is set automatically ''before'' the entity file is loaded.'''
structureFields.name: Folder

structureFields.description: (Clientside) Set this to true if your entity has animations.
structureFields.name: AutomaticFrameAdvance

structureFields.description: (Clientside) Category the ENT is in
structureFields.name: Category

structureFields.description: Whether this ENT should be displayed in the Q menu
structureFields.name: Spawnable

structureFields.description: Whether the entity supports Editing. See [[Editable Entities]] for more info.
structureFields.name: Editable

structureFields.description: Whether or not only admins can spawn the ENT from their Q menu
structureFields.name: AdminOnly

structureFields.description: (Clientside) Nice name of the ENT
structureFields.name: PrintName

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The author of the ENT
structureFields.name: Author

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The contacts of the ENT creator
structureFields.name: Contact

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The purpose of the ENT creation
structureFields.name: Purpose

structureFields.description: (Clientside) How to use your entity
structureFields.name: Instructions

structureFields.description: (Clientside) The SENT's render group, see {{Enum|RENDERGROUP}}.
structureFields.name: RenderGroup

structureFields.description: (Serverside) Disable the ability for players to duplicate this SENT.
structureFields.name: DisableDuplicator

structureFields.description:
(Clientside) Sets the spawnmenu content icon type for the entity, used by spawnmenu in the Sandbox-derived gamemodes.
See {{LibraryFunction|spawnmenu|AddContentType}} for more information.
structureFields.name: ScriptedEntityType
